fields.description:
Access logs form should be displayed in the Health Checks section on the following pages...
- Create ELB Wizard
- ELB detail page (Health Checks tab)
fields.summary: ELB - allow user to specify ELB logs location (in OSG)

comments.body:
[~spark]: Looking at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/enable-access-logs.html we seem to need support for bucket policies to enable access logs for an ELB.  Could you confirm if that's the case, since EUCA-651 hasn't been implemented yet?

/cc [~zhill], [~jloza]

[~kgill] Access log can be used with bucket ACL in 4.2 (eventually bucket policy is the right direction). There are 2 different ways to manage access to s3 and we tested with bucket ACL (legacy). More detail can be found in the comment section of EUCA-10428. 

One caveat is that we require users to know the account ID of the ELB service's system account (the ID is used when writing the policies or ACL). This is unfortunate consequence of us not having static IDs for the well known services (unlike AWS: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/enable-access-logs.html),

[~spark]: Thank you for the detailed help!  

[~jloza]: Looks as though we may need an additional field in the Access Logs wireframe to enter the ELB service account ID, which must be obtained from the cloud admin (since there's no API call to discover that).  See EUCA-10428 for more info.

[~kgill], [~spark], [~zhill], my understanding was that we could retrieve this ID programmatically and thus transparently to the user. Having the end user manually request and enter the ID is poor UX. Originally [~spark] had thought we could get this via info returned with a security group, and I believe [~zhill] had said this wouldn't require manual entry when we discussed this prior to wireframing.
[~jloza] I don't think there is programmatic way to access the ID. Security group contains the account ID but afaik console doesn't have the access to ELB system account.

The identifier required for a bucket ACL is the canonicalID (which only exists in the S3 context, not IAM) or the account email address. One option is to use a well-known and constant fake email address for system accounts. Something like: loadbalancing@euca-internal. This would raise email domain isolation concerns, but we could do something to mitigate that as well. That would require a change to the service accounts definition in the server-side, so it isn't free.

[~zhill], is this something that could get coordinated and done in time for 4.2? I don't think access logs are a showstopper for 4.2 for the GUI, so we could always push this one user story to 4.3 to get this improvement implemented in the back end if it's significant work. It's worth it to keep our UX Certified Awesome (TM)!
[~zhill] Do we currently support account email address in ACL? If so, I can easily add the fake email when the ELB system account is initialized.  /cc [~rusvika], in case.

[~spark], [~zhill]: If we opt for the canned email approach for the ELB system account, could you let me know what EUCA ticket we're using to track that so I can mark it as a blocker for GUI-1622?

/cc [~jloza]

I'm not a big fan of using fake email addresses. If we go along that route, we should make sure that email prefix/suffix used for these emails is reserved and can only be set by the system, also we need to ensure that on the upgraded system these emails are not in use.

[~rusvika], if we use invalid email addresses, would that be sufficient? e.g. loadbalancer@{euca-services}

If so, I think the only change is in the service account init and an upgrade step to add it to existing service accounts.
Added link to s3 acl issue for specifying system/service accounts.
[~zhill], the restrictions specified in my previous comment need to be enforced.

[~jloza] and [~kgill], I think a client-side tool to get the proper accountIds/canonicalIds once during console install/config is the best long-term solution. Justification is in the linked euca ticket. I'm pursuing who, what, and when for a tool to solve the issue.

In the mean time, the console should be able to get the accountIds from a config file on a per-region/cloud basis. Eucalyptus object storage supports using the AccountId in the bucket ACL (this is not supported in S3) so we should be able to use the accountId for bucket ACL now and in the future switch in the console to using the same ID in a bucket policy.

Thanks for the update [~zhill].  I guess we can't use the canned ELB account IDs listed at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/enable-access-logs.html since the ACL id must be a 64-digit canonical ID, not the 12-digit account ID.  Do you recall if there's a way to obtain the canonical ID from the account ID?

This must be 100% automated, programmatically retrieved, ZERO user intervention beyond perhaps at best a click to retrieve. Anything less is unacceptable from UX POV. 

NOT THE FOOT! DON'T MAKE ME USE THE FOOT!
Update: Garrett had a good suggestion that I need to look into. I'll update again today. I think we may be able to do something simple and not require a separate config step.
Sweet. Go [~gholms], you get a UX gold star.

[~kgill], discussed this ticket in mgmt mtg today and everyone agrees that this story should go ahead and get into 4.2. Vic says it's OK from a test standpoint, and we are not going to a bug fix freeze from QA for several weeks yet. Risk of regression is worth getting this in. [~zhill] is about to push his fix (today, [~zhill]?) and so let's get this one in.

[~dkavanagh], [~zhill]: I'm getting a 403 response when calling DescribeServices, although I'm hitting our dev cloud which doesn't contain the fixes in EUCA-11064. Here's the output from a pdb session... {code} ipdb> resp = self.iam_conn.make_request('DescribeServices') ipdb> resp.read() '403 ForbiddenForbiddenForbidden' ipdb> self.iam_conn.get_response('DescribeServices', params={}, verb='GET') *** BotoServerError: BotoServerError: 403 Forbidden 403 ForbiddenForbiddenForbidden {code} I don't know what the XML format of the response would be, so I'm pretty much blocked on this ticket. /cc [~jloza]

I would verify the endpoint you should be using for that request. Second, I would modify the signing method used for that connection to make the request anonymous.

https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/develop/boto/auth.py#L113

Zach's example uses an older calling format that predates support for filters.  A DescribeServices request to the empyrean endpoint should do it:

{code}
DescribeServices DEBUG   request url: http://empyrean.mycloud.devzero.com:8773/
DescribeServices DEBUG   request data: Action: DescribeServices
DescribeServices DEBUG   request data: Filter.1.Name: service-type
DescribeServices DEBUG   request data: Filter.1.Value.1: loadbalancing
DescribeServices DEBUG   request data: Version: eucalyptus
{code}

While it is silly, the Version=eucalyptus parameter is significant and may not be omitted.
[~gholms]: Thank you Garrett!  Do you have an example of how to make that call via Boto?
[~sjones], does that require both dns name prefix *and* service path, or is just like the other services?
[~dkavanagh], the dns name is not required, but if using dns names that is the correct name for the service type. The path is required for all "internal" services currently.

I decided to play with this (because I like API stuff) and am getting this: 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Method: GET 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Empyrean/ 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Data: 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Headers: {} 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Host: bootstrap.g-22-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Port: 8773 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Params: {'Action': 'DescribeServices'} 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={'port': 8773, 'timeout': 70} 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Token: None 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:query_string in body: Action=DescribeServices 2015-08-11 11:47:06,871 boto [DEBUG]:Final headers: {'Content-Length': '23', 'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded', 'Host': 'bootstrap.g-22-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com', 'User-Agent': 'Boto/2.38.0 Python/2.7.6 Darwin/14.3.0'} 2015-08-11 11:47:07,210 boto [DEBUG]:Response headers: [('content-length', '156'), ('content-type', 'text/plain; charset=UTF-8'), ('connection', 'close')] 2015-08-11 11:47:07,210 boto [DEBUG]:404 Not Foundunknownunknown One correction: 2015-08-11 12:03:13,150 boto [DEBUG]:Params: {'Action': 'DescribeServices', 'Version': 'eucalyptus'} looking for more...

[~zhill], did you make a change in your code to handle STS creds for this call? I'm getting this as [~sjones] indicated I would, so we need to address this somehow. 2015-08-11 13:05:53,022 boto [DEBUG]:403 ForbiddenTemporary credentials forbidden for serviceTemporary credentials forbidden for service
[~dkavanagh] and [~kgill], the fix for euca-11249 is done. You should have STS and gui token access to the call. Let me know if additional issues come up.

[~zhill], I built a system from nighties today. It still fails to accept STS tokens. I hope that I simply have the wrong code. http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/967/ This is from boto's debug: 2015-08-20 15:52:55,620 boto [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: GET bootstrap.a-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com /services/Empyrean/ AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAAA3AH7GUFNLA4WJK&Action=DescribeServices&SecurityToken=ZXVjYQABd0k36G8I4T55s10KlPagx4dxd8QRZuSRrwrBQ3f1XPwJ3yQLVP2U0cX0JMVFb%2Fs%2Bt1ZQkun2V06SaKKYH3IKNkJzI5zfU%2FDCRaxjDn9F6FvwEI8PeAqLCCNICENVdgAq%2Bm1fP7PAIjGhknLoK8EIkY3QoyBNIi%2BK4SCV1DzShnyigouSEuk0XIKUGow7VwM%2FIdWRisTzvA2T8KUrRoj7vetEX%2BBpHjd2NocbUygaSx8%2BcBH1hWMivA%3D%3D&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2015-08-20T19%3A52%3A55Z&Version=eucalyptus 2015-08-20 15:52:55,620 boto [DEBUG]:len(b64)=44 2015-08-20 15:52:55,620 boto [DEBUG]:base64 encoded digest: bOsUY3xYcGh8fTZdOfta+3xYzr+ezMRXSYAcYvMCLJ4= 2015-08-20 15:52:55,620 boto [DEBUG]:query_string: AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAAA3AH7GUFNLA4WJK&Action=DescribeServices&SecurityToken=ZXVjYQABd0k36G8I4T55s10KlPagx4dxd8QRZuSRrwrBQ3f1XPwJ3yQLVP2U0cX0JMVFb%2Fs%2Bt1ZQkun2V06SaKKYH3IKNkJzI5zfU%2FDCRaxjDn9F6FvwEI8PeAqLCCNICENVdgAq%2Bm1fP7PAIjGhknLoK8EIkY3QoyBNIi%2BK4SCV1DzShnyigouSEuk0XIKUGow7VwM%2FIdWRisTzvA2T8KUrRoj7vetEX%2BBpHjd2NocbUygaSx8%2BcBH1hWMivA%3D%3D&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2015-08-20T19%3A52%3A55Z&Version=eucalyptus Signature: bOsUY3xYcGh8fTZdOfta+3xYzr+ezMRXSYAcYvMCLJ4= 2015-08-20 15:52:55,620 boto [DEBUG]:Final headers: {'Content-Length': '0', 'Host': 'bootstrap.a-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com', 'User-Agent': 'Boto/2.38.0 Python/2.7.6 Darwin/14.3.0'} 2015-08-20 15:52:58,362 boto [DEBUG]:Response headers: [('date', 'Thu, 20 Aug 2015 19:52:57 UTC'), ('content-length', '228'), ('content-type', 'text/plain; charset=UTF-8'), ('connection', 'close')] 2015-08-20 15:52:58,362 boto [DEBUG]:403 ForbiddenTemporary credentials forbidden for serviceTemporary credentials forbidden for service 2015-08-20 15:52:58,362 boto [ERROR]:403 Forbidden The eucalyptus package installed is: eucalyptus-4.2.0-0.0.23734.593.20150812git3f4d128.el6.x86_64

[~dkavanagh], that looks like a quite old 'nightlies' version--8/12/2015. That does not include the euca-11249 fix. I don't know if we have true nightlies, but I can confirm that commit: 3f4d128 is older than my fixes.
A broken nightly job is being investigated. I'll update once that's fixed.
I updated the setup last night from new packages and this morning can make the call! Thanks, [~zhill]

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1518

I'll go review the stuff you did. The stuff I did is in models/auth.py, models/admin.py and views/elbs.py
Don't forget UX review!!!

An example of the access log content is:
2015-08-21T15:22:35 dak-logging-elb 10.5.1.30:65128 10.111.76.188:8888 0.000000 0.004000 -1 200 -1 1904 17999 "GET /static/4.1.2-1832-g68ca391/js/pages/bucket_contents.js HTTP/1.1"
2015-08-21T15:22:33 dak-logging-elb 10.5.1.30:65123 10.111.76.188:8888 0.000000 0.021000 -1 200 -1 2006 15550 "GET /static/4.1.2-1832-g68ca391/fonts/font-awesome/fontawesome-webfont.woff2?v=4.3.0 HTTP/1.1"
2015-08-21T15:22:36 dak-logging-elb 10.5.1.30:65128 10.111.76.188:8888 0.000000 0.004000 -1 304 -1 2001 361 "GET /static/4.1.2-1832-g68ca391/js/thirdparty/magic-search/magic_search.html HTTP/1.1"

2015-08-21T15:22:36 dak-logging-elb 10.5.1.30:65127 10.111.76.188:8888 0.000000 0.229000 -1 200 -1 2139 1647 "POST /buckets/elb-logging-dak/contents/dak?dak HTTP/1.1"

This came from the console running in a scaling group and behind an ELB (w/ logging enabled)
I forgot since I didn't do anything UXy here.

Great job, y'all! A couple of things:

Create ELB wizard:

* When I click enable logging and then accept the warning dialog stuff, the focus should be inside the bucket name widget when I return to the create elb wizard. Right now I am getting a validation warning that this field is required when I just saw the widget set for the first time, and you know that's in my top 5 pet peeves. 
* bucket name bubble help text does not match wireframe
* on create bucket dialog, label and field should match width of submit button please, and there's too much whitespace under the submit button. 
* Summary does not include when logging is enabled

ELB details page:
* access logs should be on general tab and implementation does not include links shown in wireframe
[~jloza]: Back to you for UX review.

Fantastic job, [~kgill]!

UX review passed, ready for code review. Dunno what the plan is for bringing [~ashamblin] into code review cycle yet so assigned to [~dkavanagh].
[~kgill], any comment on my PR comment?
Punting back to implement the "don't show me this again" for the ELB Access Logs confirmation dialog.

[~jloza]: QQ about the "don't show this again" option in the access logs confirmation dialog... Do we want that confirmation to persist across the wizard and the detail page?  Meaning, if I'm on the wizard and check the "don't show again" option, should that setting apply on the detail page as well or should those be presented/saved separately?
hi [~kgill] as long as the user has selected don't show me in one spot, I think it would be ideal if that persisted to the other spot as well. Thanks!
Resubmitting for UX review now that we have a "don't show me again" option for the ELB access logs confirmation dialog (on the wizard and detail page).
UX review passed! Thanks for checkboxing! Passing back to [~dkavanagh] to merge if code review is done (you're out picking up Ryan or I would have just asked and merged this myself, sorry!).

Verified on QA console shared setups 1 (non-VPC) and 2 (VPC) on a Macintosh running Chrome Version 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit), Firefox 41.0.1, and Safari 9.0.

"Enable logging" appears in the:

* "Create load balancer" "Health Checks & Advanced" tab
* "Create load balancer" "Summary"
* Load balancer details "General" tab.
Released in 4.2
